info.title: ULAPPH Cloud Desktop
info.description: An API for the ULAPPH Cloud Desktop which can be used to manage authentications, drives, slides, articles, media and things

get.summary: googleOauth2() - Redirect to Google Oauth2 server

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Required. The client ID for your application. You can find this value in the API Console.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Required. Determines where the API server redirects the user after the user completes the authorization flow. The value must exactly match one of the redirect_uri values listed for your project in the API Console. Note that the http or https scheme, case, and trailing slash ('/') must all match.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: Required. Determines whether the Google OAuth 2.0 endpoint returns an authorization code. Set the parameter value to code for web server applications.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Required. A space-delimited list of scopes that identify the resources that your application could access on the user's behalf. These values inform the consent screen that Google displays to the user.

parameters.name: access_type
parameters.description: Recommended. Indicates whether your application can refresh access tokens when the user is not present at the browser. Valid parameter values are online, which is the default value, and offline.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Recommended. Specifies any string value that your application uses to maintain state between your authorization request and the authorization server's response. The server returns the exact value that you send as a name=value pair in the hash (#) fragment of the redirect_uri after the user consents to or denies your application's access request.

parameters.name: include_granted_scopes
parameters.description: Optional. Enables applications to use incremental authorization to request access to additional scopes in context.

parameters.name: login_hint
parameters.description: Optional. If your application knows which user is trying to authenticate, it can use this parameter to provide a hint to the Google Authentication Server.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: Optional. A space-delimited, case-sensitive list of prompts to present the user. If you don't specify this parameter, the user will be prompted only the first time your app requests access.

get.summary: googleOauth2Callback() - Callback from Google Oauth2 server

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: If the user approves the access request, then the response contains an authorization code

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: An unguessable random string. It is used to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: If the user does not approve the request, the response contains an error message

post.summary: googleOauth2ExchangeCode() - Exchange code for token from Google auth server

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The authorization code returned from the initial request.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client ID obtained from the API Console.

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: The client secret obtained from the API Console.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: One of the redirect URIs listed for your project in the API Console.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: As defined in the OAuth 2.0 specification, this field must contain a value of authorization_code.

get.summary: githubOauth2() - Redirect to Github Oauth2 server

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Required. The client ID you received from GitHub when you registered.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URL in your application where users will be sent after authorization. See details below about redirect urls.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: A space delimited list of scopes. If not provided, scope defaults to an empty list for users that have not authorized any scopes for the application.

parameters.name: allow_signup
parameters.description: Whether or not unauthenticated users will be offered an option to sign up for GitHub during the OAuth flow.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: An unguessable random string. It is used to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks.

get.summary: googleOauth2Callback() - Callback from Github Oauth2 server

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: If the user approves the access request, then the response contains an authorization code

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: An unguessable random string. It is used to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: If the user does not approve the request, the response contains an error message

post.summary: googleOauth2ExchangeCode() - Exchange code for token from Google auth server

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The authorization code returned from the initial request.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client ID obtained from the API Console.

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: The client secret obtained from the API Console.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: One of the redirect URIs listed for your project in the API Console.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The unguessable random string you optionally provided in Step 1.

get.summary: handlerOuath2MicrosoftCall() - Redirect to Microsoft Oauth2 server

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Required. The client ID for your application. You can find this value in the API Console.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Required. Determines where the API server redirects the user after the user completes the authorization flow. The value must exactly match one of the redirect_uri values listed for your project in the API Console. Note that the http or https scheme, case, and trailing slash ('/') must all match.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: Required. Determines whether the Google OAuth 2.0 endpoint returns an authorization code. Set the parameter value to code for web server applications.

parameters.name: response_mode
parameters.description: Required. Determines whether the Google OAuth 2.0 endpoint returns an authorization code. Set the parameter value to query for web server applications.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Required. A space-delimited list of scopes that identify the resources that your application could access on the user's behalf. These values inform the consent screen that Google displays to the user.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Recommended. Specifies any string value that your application uses to maintain state between your authorization request and the authorization server's response. The server returns the exact value that you send as a name=value pair in the hash (#) fragment of the redirect_uri after the user consents to or denies your application's access request.

get.summary: microsoftOauth2Callback() - Callback from Microsoft Oauth2 server

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: If the user approves the access request, then the response contains an authorization code

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: An unguessable random string. It is used to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: If the user does not approve the request, the response contains an error message

post.summary: microsoftOauth2ExchangeCode() - Exchange code for token from Microsoft auth server

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The authorization code returned from the initial request.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client ID obtained from the API Console.

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: The client secret obtained from the API Console.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: One of the redirect URIs listed for your project in the API Console.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: As defined in the OAuth 2.0 specification, this field must contain a value of authorization_code.

get.summary: getSlides() - Gets all public slides in this system

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The userId whom to get owned slides

get.summary: getArticles() - Gets all articles in this system

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The userId whom to get owned articles

get.summary: getCommentsCount() - Gets the current comments count of media file

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The SID of the media file

parameters.name: API_KEY
parameters.description: The API key for the ULAPPH server

get.summary: getThings() - Gets all things in this system
getThingPayload() - Gets the payload of a thing
get.description: This can only be done by the logged in users.

parameters.name: thingName
parameters.description: The thingName where payload will be retrieved

parameters.name: showPayloadOnly
parameters.description: Y or N flag to display only payload

get.summary: getThingPayloadField() - Reads the payload & get field value of a thing
get.description: This can only be done by the logged in users.

parameters.name: thingName
parameters.description: The thingName where payload will be retrieved

parameters.name: dataFormat
parameters.description: The format of data being extracted for the field which can be Bool, Float, Int, String, Array, Interface and Object.

parameters.name: jsonQuery0
parameters.description: The JSON field Level 0 which will point to the specific field value.

parameters.name: jsonQuery1
parameters.description: The JSON field Level 1 which will point to the specific field value.

parameters.name: jsonQuery2
parameters.description: The JSON field Level 2 which will point to the specific field value.

parameters.name: jsonQuery3
parameters.description: The JSON field Level 3 which will point to the specific field value.

parameters.name: jsonQuery4
parameters.description: The JSON field Level 4 which will point to the specific field value.

post.summary: postThingPayload() - Stores the payload of a thing
post.description: This can only be done by the logged in users.

parameters.name: thingName
parameters.description: The thingName where payload will be retrieved

parameters.name: isShared
parameters.description: Y or N if thing is shared

parameters.name: docStat
parameters.description: Document status if Worldwide, ULAPPH Only, Personal

post.summary: controlThingPayload() - Sends control signal from cloud to device via Firebase
post.description: This can only be done by the logged in users.

parameters.name: thingName
parameters.description: The thingName which will be controlled by payload

post.summary: sendAlarm() - Sends alarm to system user
post.description: This can only be done by the logged in users.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: The userName which will receive the message

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The content of message to be sent

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The notification object to create

post.summary: scrapeWebsite() - Scrapes a given website into a slide & text
post.description: This can scrape websites given parameters.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of website to be scraped

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: The selector where specific data is to be scraped

parameters.name: extract_images
parameters.description: Extract images from selected area (Y/N)

parameters.name: extract_links
parameters.description: Extract links from selected area (Y/N)

parameters.name: extract_text
parameters.description: Extract texts from selected area (Y/N)

parameters.name: text_len
parameters.description: Limit text length

parameters.name: inc_raw_text
parameters.description: Include raw text from whole web page (Y/N)

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: If blank will output as slides; if value is alertify, it will show in UWM desktop. If value is json, it will output in json format.

post.summary: extractPlanner() - Extract planner tasks from Office 365
post.description: This will extract the planner tasks given parameters.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The token for the target planner

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The TDSMEDIA containing config for the target planner

get.summary: getSystemHealthz() - Gets status health of the system
get.description: This can be used for monitoring purposes.

post.summary: jsOtto() - Executes a Javascript in a VM
post.description: This can be used for creating APIs in Javascript.

parameters.name: DEBUG
parameters.description: Enabled and disable debug mode (Y/N)

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The SID of script to be executed

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The input object to be processed

server_token.name: Authorization
server_token.description: The apiKey to access this system

externalDocs.description: Find out more about ULAPPH Cloud Desktop.
